comments.commentBody:
"Mrs. Clinton, while exuding a great deal of fire and energy at a big rally on Sunday night near Des Moines, frames her candidacy much more cerebrally and pragmatically."

I support Hillary Clinton, but I think she is running too much on her RESUME and not enough as a REBEL, like Sanders.

Moving on the NH, I hope that she will push the idea of a woman presidency to the max. I suggest that she try a symbol, such as two "V" signs with her hands together, to form a "W" for woman.

I think having a woman president would be huge, finally after 227 years. This would encourage women and men to rise up and assert themselves more. I believe this would help to shake up the system and stimulate or stagnant economy.

From STAG-NATION to IMAGI-NATION to DETERMI-NATION.

One step for (W)oman. One giant lead for (H)umankind.
==========================================
at least it wasnt trump
(Bus)Ted Cruz will follow Mike Huckabee and Rick Santorum to the dustbin of unelectable general election candidates - thankfully.

you have none of those to fear in canada

lucky you

bored billionaires do all sorts of weird things

fly balloons around th world,build new kinds of rocket ships, play polo, run for president

its all a game when you have that kind of money
"The last Christian died on the cross."  (Nietzsche)

The anger and meanspiritedness of Cruz and Rubio is certainly appalling.  This from contestants for an office whose goal should be to try to bring us together.  What's to be expected, an Enemies List like President Nixon maintained?  The cheap appeal to religion is altogether transparent and another major cause for worry.  As Sinclair Lewis wrote, "When fascism comes to America it will be wrapped in the flag and carrying a cross."

Does Marco Rubio believe he won Iowa? His "acceptance" speech made it sound that way. It's like someone who comes in third place at the Academy Awards and goes to the podium to accept a statue that only exists in their mind. And per usual (as was mentioned in this editorial) Rubio couldn't give a talk without wretchedly demonizing President Obama and Hillary Clinton. And it's done in a kind of dark vicious way that makes the skin crawl.

And that kind of tasteless Republican vitriol makes no sense. Because sooner or later he, or whomever wins that party's nomination, will appear in the general election. Do they believe that only Republican votes are needed to sweep them into the White House. What does that say about judgement much less class?

Donald Trump accepted his loss better than expected. As for Ted Cruz, I personally couldn't watch or listen to anything that cringe-worthy so called born again Christian had to say. As Mahatma Gandhi once observed, "I like your Christ but not your Christians. They are so unlike your Christ."

The Donald got some comeuppance.
Megyn Kelly should be feeling a bit of well-deserved vindication tonight.
look at th total number of votes cast

th rich and th banks are truly to be feared

yolure immune up there in canada from at least those 2 threats

As a practicing Catholic I couldn't agree more. I don't think God or his son Jesus Christ endorses any politician seeking political office. Whenever a pol mentions either God's or Jesus Christ's name I cringe. I do not think their religious beliefs, the pols, are sincere and those people who only vote along religious lines and believe these politicians I feel sorry for and I keep them in my prayers.

I first heard the term "Judeo-Christian values" on hate talk radio Hannity/O'Rielly etc. It struck me as another one of those 'my clan is better than your clan' divisive term. Since then, it has been very disappointing to see the republican presidential contenders like Rubio & Carson repeating it on national stage. Of course, the irony is that the actions & policy choices of GOP is the very opposite of these values.
Actually, too bad we can't send Cruz back to Canada where he belongs.

Ted Cruz praising God! The country based on Judeo-Christian?
First and foremost why he won, he says.

Insulting to democracy which should be the reason any nominee won tonight.

This religious manipulation cannot continue to steer this election. America is a country for all. It is insulting to insinuate it is created on the likes of Cruz's religious beliefs.

We see indeed that as we get closer and closer to the election - maybe even on the drive there - that voters become more sane. Carson voters excluded.

Rubio's strong 3rd place may boost him to 2nd in New Hampshire, and Ted Cruise may fall by the wayside as some form of half-sanity whispers into the ears of GOP voters. (I hope we can agree that Rubio is at least better than Cruz.)

And for the Democrats we see that the supporters of Bernie are willing to fight to the tooth and nail to compete with Hillary. While I expect a Bernie victory in New Hampshire, I unfortunately have to assume that the superdelegate situation will not play out in favor of the #1 enemy of the DNC chair.

More debates for both sides will be telling. Onward!
I'll miss Huckabee too.

Put this in a 300 degree oven at 3pm and it was ready at 6 for dinner. After reading earlier reviews, I chose to spoon off the rendered fat/remaining oil after Step 2 and before placing in the oven. Very nice result... Not amazing. Sifton's choice to replace the packet of Ranch is a good one. Hardly time consuming to whisk together. Suggestion: Watch the amount of salt used in Step 1. Perhaps 1tsp is sufficient. Mine was borderline too salty.
ACW - My suggestion is to have certain prisons devoted to only those serving natural life sentences.  That at least eliminates the issue of their interacting with those convicted of lesser crimes.
meredith - Dr. K. has mentioned both A.L.E.C. and the Koch Bros. on several different occasions in his column and blog.

"Smarmy little two-boots..."
That comment will make me smile for weeks.

Democrats are "unlikely to show up for her in November... they'll stay home like a number of Republicans did when Romney ran."

If so, they can take pride in electing a President Rubio. Just because people can't get absolutely everything they want doesn't mean they should throw their hands up in despair.

In a caucus like Iowa you hand a sheet of paper to a party boss with your preference written on it and hope for the best, there are no ballots or audit trails.   Iowa was election fraud in action by the party bosses.  It proves that Cruze is a phoney, a party insider and that Rubio was simply a party insider.  Trump will have to crush the establishment candidates if he wishes to win.

I'd disagree, Michjas....Trump *barely* squeaked out second place.

Only 2,384 votes separated the two; given Trump's boast of a "great victory" in Iowa yesterday, I'd say he got his hat handed to him.

He's driven the entire campaign like a cartoon car salesman who says all the other lots will rip you off.  Just because the TV relentlessly sucked off of him like a parasite in need of a sales and circulation bump does NOT make a candidate.
Trump has been the dominant force in the campaign to date.  I think he got all the vote today  --  some for, some against.

Mars? Why go so far. Come join us in Toronto Canada where the food is great, people are friendly and your dollar is worth $1.40.

We, are happy to host and we still get CNN,Fox and CNBC.

Jake, you talk sense, why flee to Mars not Canada, a bus ride away? But what is Canada's political refugee policy? How many of us can they take? They've already admitted Syrians refugees, now what about Americans? We may try to get into Canada for some affordable health care, as ACA prices keep rising.

Bernie Sanders tells how he once took a busload of Vermont women who had cancer, into Canada to buy their needed medications at 1/10th the cost of the US.
If these are the best people we can find to run for president, we're in for a bleak future.  Sign me up for a trip to Mars.

No it isn't, these so called Christians don't vote on Christian values, they vote for whoever spews the most bigotry and ignorance.

You can barbecue live kittens while foreclosing on an orphanage as long as you have an "R" after your name and you throw the word "God" around right wingers will vote for you.
Donald Trump's performance in fundamentalist, bible belt Iowa is a miracle for someone who is in many ways a New York City liberal.
And they are now shilling for Trump!

Yawn.

Santorum and Huckabee won the last two Iowa Repiblican contests.
Yes, hello American Taliband

But there is the interesting fact that Hispanics are only 5.6% of Iowa's population and I suspect that relatively few of them are Republicans.  And yet Republicans in Iowa put two Hispanics in first and third places.

Sandra, are the Iowans really LIKE the Taliban? Do you understand that unfair hype like yours prevents accommodation between the party and prevents progress on our problems?

As someone who is not a Republican and sympathizes with the socialist Sanders (who actually did very well in Iowa). I am appalled at the prejudice that so many show against the religious Christians that they would not dream of showing towards Muslims.

So the Religious Right won Iowa, with no respect for people with other beliefs, no respect for our Constitution. Salvation doesn't come from manipulating public policy to match their religious dogma. That's tyranny.
Cruz looked less Presidential in his speech and more like the Clergy leader who came ashore to preach.

I don't think this analysis is correct.
Trump never expected to win Iowa. He merely stroked Iowans' egos in order to do as well as possible, and he made a respectable 2nd place showing.
New Hampshire is a slam-dunk for Trump and Cruz will be lucky to finish 4th.
Rubio will not stand up to attacks by either Trump or Cruz, and he doesn't stand a chance one-on-one against either Clinton or Sanders.

I worked for the government and we would send emails discussing some trade related item. When the final report was completed, it was then classified. Since, no one had any notion that the trivialities we were dealing with could be so sensitive, we didn't think anything of it to discuss the material in emails.
